title: Ticket #6352: Improve condor_top
description:
The current condor_top is more or less a straight port of condor_top.pl to Python except that it uses the Python bindings to query the Collector directly for ClassAds rather than reading them from files passed via command-line. While helpful, there are many improvements that could be made to condor_top:

  1. Allow for ClassAds to be queried directly (current behavior) or supplied from the command-line (enhancement).
  2. Add a "non-live" mode where stdout can be redirected or piped.
  3. Default to monitoring whatever the role of the current machine is. If multiple roles are defined, default to monitoring the Schedd.
  4. Focus the columnar output on ClassAd-to-ClassAd changes (in runtimes, counts, rates, etc.) rather than totals since daemon start.
  5. Minor fixes and changes to condor_top (see below).

These changes will make condor_top a more flexible tool that will allow admins to quickly find what subprocesses are spinning their wheels as well as help us to provide quicker support by analyzing emailed (i.e. offline) ClassAds or condor_top output.

Minor fixes:

  • Decrease the display width by one to avoid wrap in some terminal emulators.
  • Fix the RAM suffixes, they are off by one.
  • Display the daemon name and query time(s).
  • Discard some specific attributes (e.g. SCGetAutocluster_cchit).
remarks:
2017-Jul-19 10:01:42 by jpatton:
  1. condor_top can either take two ClassAd files or grab ClassAds live from the Collector.
  2. Continual live updates requires use of a flag (-l), otherwise condor_top prints once and quits.
  3. condor_top defaults to monitoring the local Schedd if run on a submit node. (Startd on execute node.)
  4. When running in "live" mode, condor_top prints out the recent duty cycle as a placeholder.
  5. Added/modified a bunch of columns. Their descriptions are in the man page.
  6. Added an option (-c) to choose which set of columns to display. "-c all" is fun with a wide terminal screen.
  7. When stdout is piped, columns/lines are not fit to the terminal window.
  8. All the "Updating" and "Warning" info now goes through stderr.

CODE_REVIEW this looks very good. A lot of good improvements here.
